batch_info.description: Diverse chronic disease synthetic clinical documents for healthcare AI evaluation

expected_detections.signal: Depression documented in prior year but not addressed in current records
expected_detections.expected_finding: Major Depressive Disorder (F33.1) was active in 2023, patient self-discontinued sertraline. PHQ-9 of 16 in July 2024 indicates ongoing depression requiring treatment.

expected_detections.signal: CKD has progressed from Stage 2 to Stage 3b
expected_detections.expected_finding: Prior year shows CKD Stage 2 (eGFR 78), current labs show eGFR 45 which is Stage 3b. Problem list staging should be updated.

expected_detections.signal: Classic OSA symptoms not yet diagnosed
expected_detections.expected_finding: HRA and progress notes document loud snoring, witnessed apneas, morning headaches, daytime fatigue in obese patient. Sleep study ordered but never completed. OSA highly likely.

expected_detections.signal: Anemia of CKD not formally documented
expected_detections.expected_finding: Hemoglobin 11.8 g/dL in context of CKD Stage 3b indicates anemia of chronic kidney disease. Should be added to problem list.
HRA reveals medication cost concerns and difficulty affording Jardiance ($50/month). Should trigger medication assistance evaluation.
Patient taking calcium at same time as levothyroxine causing drug interaction and hypothyroid symptoms. TSH rose from 2.4 to 12.8 due to absorption issue.

expected_detections.signal: Prediabetes progressed to diabetes but diagnosis timing unclear
expected_detections.expected_finding: A1c progressed from 6.2% (prediabetes) to 6.5% (diabetes) in June 2024. Diagnosis was appropriately made and documented.

expected_detections.signal: Adjustment disorder with anxiety/depression diagnosed but may not be in problem list
expected_detections.expected_finding: October 2024 note documents PHQ-9 of 12 and GAD-7 of 14 with diagnosis of adjustment disorder. Verify this is added to official problem list.

expected_detections.signal: Depression/anxiety symptoms in HRA require clinical correlation
expected_detections.expected_finding: HRA shows several days of feeling down, difficulty concentrating, anxiety - confirmed by PHQ-9/GAD-7 in subsequent visit.
Patient had thyroidectomy for Graves disease. Problem list should be updated to reflect status post and add iatrogenic hypothyroidism.

expected_detections.signal: Insulin rationing due to cost - life threatening
expected_detections.expected_finding: Patient was taking half-doses of insulin due to inability to afford medications. A1c rose to 11.2% with DKA risk. CRITICAL PATIENT SAFETY ISSUE.

expected_detections.signal: Depression not treated after medication self-discontinuation
expected_detections.expected_finding: Patient stopped sertraline due to cost. PHQ-9 was 18 (moderately severe). Depression should remain on active problem list.
Prior year shows CKD Stage 3, now eGFR 15 which is Stage 5/ESKD. Dialysis imminent.

expected_detections.signal: Food insecurity and medication cost barriers
expected_detections.expected_finding: HRA reveals difficulty affording healthy food and medication cost concerns.

expected_detections.signal: Osteoarthritis found on exam but not in problem list
expected_detections.expected_finding: October 2024 note documents Heberden's nodes, joint stiffness, and crepitus consistent with osteoarthritis.

expected_detections.signal: Tobacco use disorder now in remission
expected_detections.expected_finding: Patient quit smoking in April 2024. Problem list should be updated to 'in remission'.

patients.notes: Clean baseline with well-controlled atopic disease.

expected_detections.signal: Classic OSA symptom cluster in HRA before diagnosis
expected_detections.expected_finding: February 2024 HRA documents loud snoring, witnessed apneas, morning headaches, daytime sleepiness - classic OSA cluster. Subsequently confirmed.

expected_detections.signal: Severe OSA diagnosed - requires problem list update
expected_detections.expected_finding: Sleep study confirmed severe OSA (AHI 38). OSA must be added to problem list.
Sleep study confirmed severe OSA in patient with COPD. Overlap syndrome carries significantly increased mortality.
Initial labs showed Hgb 16.8, Hct 50.2 - secondary polycythemia from nocturnal hypoxemia.

expected_detections.signal: CKD has progressed from Stage 3a to 3b
expected_detections.expected_finding: Prior year shows CKD Stage 3a, current eGFR 42 indicates Stage 3b. ICD code should be updated.

expected_detections.signal: CKD has progressed to Stage 5 - ESKD
expected_detections.expected_finding: eGFR 15 indicates Stage 5 CKD. Patient has uremic symptoms and dialysis initiation is imminent.

expected_detections.signal: Uremic symptoms indicating need for dialysis
expected_detections.expected_finding: Nausea, anorexia, metallic taste, fatigue - uremic symptom cluster indicating dialysis is needed.

expected_detections.signal: Depression/anxiety symptoms in patient facing dialysis
expected_detections.expected_finding: HRA shows feeling down/hopeless and anxious about dialysis. May warrant formal depression screening.
eGFR declined from 52 to 42. Now Stage 3b.

patients.notes: Demonstrates good mental health care coordination. Serves as positive example.

expected_detections.expected_finding: Patient developed hypothyroidism from lithium therapy. TSH monitoring and levothyroxine adjustment needed.

expected_detections.signal: Weight gain on mood stabilizers affecting metabolic health
expected_detections.expected_finding: Obesity (BMI 32) and hyperlipidemia as metabolic effects of psychiatric medications. Requires monitoring.

patients.notes: Positive outcome case - demonstrates successful PTSD treatment with CPT. PCL-5 dropped from 42 to 28. Serves as example of treatment response.

expected_detections.signal: Secondary Sjogren's syndrome symptoms in RA patient
expected_detections.expected_finding: Patient with seropositive RA now has dry eyes and dry mouth. SSA/SSB antibodies ordered. Secondary Sjogren's syndrome likely.
Fingertip numbness at night, positive Phalen's and Tinel's bilaterally. Clinical carpal tunnel diagnosis.
HRA notes adalimumab copay is $400/month and husband retired. Financial stress affecting care.

expected_detections.signal: Bisphosphonate failure - worsening DEXA despite 5+ years therapy
expected_detections.expected_finding: T-scores worsening at all sites despite alendronate. CTX elevated indicating inadequate suppression. Transition to anabolic therapy (romosozumab) required.
Exertional chest tightness and new systolic murmur while on romosozumab (has cardiovascular warnings). Requires cardiac workup.
HRA shows 'several days' of feeling down, missing independence. Subclinical depression in elderly needs monitoring.

primary_conditions: Chronic Low Back Pain with Radiculopathy

expected_detections.signal: Cauda equina syndrome symptoms - surgical emergency
expected_detections.expected_finding: Progressive bilateral leg weakness, urinary hesitancy, decreased rectal tone, expanded sensory loss. MRI confirmed cauda equina compression requiring emergent surgery.
PHQ-9 increased from 14 to 16 (moderately severe). Patient expresses hopelessness. Duloxetine increased.
HRA documented leg weakness and increased numbness months before cauda equina presentation.

expected_detections.signal: MoCA dropped 6 points in 6 months - faster than expected
expected_detections.expected_finding: MoCA 20 -> 18 -> 12 in less than 1 year. Rapid decline concerning for secondary causes (NPH, CVA, infection).

expected_detections.signal: New gait changes and neuropsychiatric symptoms
expected_detections.expected_finding: New shuffling gait, paranoia, irritability, incontinence - progression to moderate stage with concerning features.
Wife providing all care, not sleeping, tearful. Major concern requiring support services.
New visual hallucinations in PD patient on dopamine agonist. Concerning for PD psychosis. Pramipexole reduction needed.
Coughing with liquids concerning for aspiration. Requires urgent swallow evaluation.
4-point MoCA decline concerning for PD dementia development.
Advancing to Stage 3 with dyskinesias, freezing, falls. UPDRS worsened 20->34.
Papilledema on exam, positional headaches, pulsatile tinnitus, weight gain - IIH confirmed on imaging. Requires urgent LP and treatment.

expected_detections.signal: Headache red flags requiring immediate workup
expected_detections.expected_finding: New headache features: positional, worse with Valsalva, visual changes. Papilledema found on exam.
Sumatriptan use 14x/month exceeds 9/month limit. Rebound headache pattern.
Lost job, stopped therapy, stopped OC (cost), missed Botox. Multiple care gaps from social stressors.
PHQ-9 15 (moderately severe) in context of unemployment. Buspirone increased.

expected_detections.signal: Barrett's esophagus progressed to low-grade dysplasia
expected_detections.expected_finding: Previously non-dysplastic Barrett's now shows LGD on surveillance EGD. Nodular lesion found. Requires RFA.
Barrett's segment grew from 4cm to 5-6cm indicating disease progression.
New solid food dysphagia concerning for stricture or dysplasia progression. Expedited EGD appropriately ordered.
Low-grade dysplasia in raised sigmoid lesion in patient with UC + PSC (highest cancer risk category). Colectomy discussion needed.

expected_detections.signal: Secondary loss of response to vedolizumab
expected_detections.expected_finding: Was in remission on vedolizumab, now flaring with active inflammation. Calprotectin rose from 45 to 380.
Hemoglobin dropped from 13.8 to 11.8 with active inflammation.
New ascites, jaundice (bili 3.2), coagulopathy (INR 1.6), encephalopathy (asterixis). MELD 8->18.

expected_detections.signal: New liver lesion concerning for HCC
expected_detections.expected_finding: New 2.8cm hypervascular lesion on ultrasound with AFP nearly doubled (4.2->8.4). HCC highly likely. MRI urgently needed.
Asterixis present, wife notes confusion/irritability, ammonia 85. HE requiring lactulose and rifaximin.
With hepatic decompensation, metformin must be stopped (lactic acidosis risk). Needs insulin.

expected_detections.signal: Active lupus nephritis with RBC casts
expected_detections.expected_finding: Rising creatinine (1.0->1.4), proteinuria worsening (UPCR 0.3->1.8), RBC casts present. Active nephritis requiring biopsy.

expected_detections.signal: Major SLEDAI increase indicating severe flare
expected_detections.expected_finding: SLEDAI-2K increased from 2 to 16. Multi-organ flare (skin, joints, hematologic, renal).
C3 88->52, C4 18->8. Complement consumption with rising anti-dsDNA (1:40->1:320).
Patient attended outdoor wedding without adequate sun protection 2 weeks before flare.

expected_detections.signal: MS breakthrough on highly effective therapy
expected_detections.expected_finding: 5+ new T2 lesions, 2 enhancing lesions, new spinal cord lesion despite ocrelizumab. Possible transition to SPMS.
EDSS worsened from 2.5 to 4.5 in 6 months. Major functional decline.

expected_detections.signal: New cognitive symptoms in MS patient
expected_detections.expected_finding: Word-finding difficulty, forgetting things, MoCA 24/30 (not tested before but impaired). Possible MS-related cognitive impairment.

expected_detections.signal: High fall risk from gait worsening
expected_detections.expected_finding: Can barely walk, tripping, leg weakness. Needs rollator. Safety concern.
8 lb weight gain, orthopnea, PND, edema to knees, BNP 2450 (from 450). Admission for IV diuresis.

expected_detections.signal: SGLT2 inhibitor nonadherence contributing to decompensation
expected_detections.expected_finding: Ran out of dapagliflozin 2 weeks ago and forgot to refill. Critical GDMT medication for HFrEF.
ICD delivered appropriate shock for VT 3 days before admission. May need VT ablation evaluation.

expected_detections.signal: Acute kidney injury in cardiorenal syndrome
expected_detections.expected_finding: Creatinine 1.8->2.4, eGFR 38->24. Cardiorenal syndrome with worsening on decompensation.
HR 105-115, rate uncontrolled on metoprolol alone. Contributing to decompensation. Adding digoxin.
Acute confusion, disorientation (thinks year is 2020), fluctuating. Triggered by infection and dehydration.
RLL consolidation, WBC 14.8, fever, procalcitonin 0.8. Pneumonia causing delirium cascade.
Aide found pill organizer untouched. Missed apixaban puts patient at stroke risk (CHA2DS2-VASc 6).
Creatinine 1.4->2.1, Na 148 (hypernatremia). Prerenal AKI from poor intake.
Getting lost, declining hygiene, burning pots, missed meds. Cannot safely live alone.

expected_detections.signal: Cannot return to independent living safely
expected_detections.expected_finding: Discharge planning needs to address inability to live alone. May need memory care.

validation_instructions.purpose: This answer key validates the agentic detection system's accuracy across diverse chronic disease domains
usage: Run the detection agent on each patient's document bundle
Compare agent findings against expected_detections for each patient
Pay special attention to critical findings
Note any false positives or novel true detections not in this key
key_test_cases: CHRONIC-2025-006: Must detect insulin rationing as critical safety issue
CHRONIC-2025-020: Must detect cauda equina syndrome symptoms
CHRONIC-2025-023: Must detect IIH with papilledema
CHRONIC-2025-025: Must detect colitis-associated dysplasia in high-risk patient
CHRONIC-2025-026: Must detect hepatic decompensation and HCC concern
CHRONIC-2025-029: Must detect HF decompensation and SGLT2i nonadherence
CHRONIC-2025-030: Must detect delirium, pneumonia, and medication nonadherence
